newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine gas firm clarifies report on investments.
newsitem.headline: Argentine gas firm clarifies report on investments.

text.p: Argentina's Gas Natural BAN clarified Tuesday that its Spanish parent Gas Natural SDG would not invest $400 million in the country as reported earlier.
On Monday the state news agency Telam reported that Gas Natural SDG would invest in Argentina $400 million over the next three years.

A spokeswoman for Gas Natural BAN told Reuters Tuesday that the $400 million referred to the economic activity expected to be generated if the government approved plans submitted by Argentina's eight gas distribution firms.
Those plans for financing the connection for some 2.5 million people who cannot afford to link up to the gas distribution network.
"Each distribution firm presented its proposal, each in it own service area," the spokeswoman said.
"We want to take gas to families in the whole country that have the network passing in front of their homes but have no economic means to make the connection."
